description: a(n) is obtained by applying the map k -> prime(k) n times, starting at n.
example: a(3) is 31 because the third prime is 5, the fifth prime is 11 and for the 3rd iteration, the eleventh prime is 31.To get a(4): 4 -> 7 -> 17 -> 59 -> 277.
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 13 2000
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 30 2008 at the suggestion of R. J. Mathar
